dt: {bc}any of a kingdom (Animalia) of living things including many-celled organisms and often many of the single-celled ones (such as {d_link|protozoans|protozoan}) that typically differ from plants in having cells without {d_link|cellulose|cellulose} walls, in lacking {d_link|chlorophyll|chlorophyll} and the capacity for {d_link|photosynthesis|photosynthesis}, in requiring more complex food materials (such as {d_link|proteins|protein}), in being organized to a greater degree of complexity, and in having the capacity for spontaneous movement and rapid motor responses to stimulation
{bc}one of the lower animals {dx_def}see {dxt|lower:3||3}{/dx_def} as distinguished from human beings
{bc}a human being considered chiefly as physical or nonrational
{bc}a person with a particular interest or aptitude

dt.t: the theater … is an entirely different {wi}animal{/wi}

et: Latin, from {it}animale{/it}, neuter of {it}animalis{/it} animate, from {it}anima{/it} soul {ma}{mat|animate|}{/ma}
shortdef: any of a kingdom (Animalia) of living things including many-celled organisms and often many of the single-celled ones (such as protozoans) that typically differ from plants in having cells without cellulose walls, in lacking chlorophyll and the capacity for photosynthesis, in requiring more complex food materials (such as proteins), in being organized to a greater degree of complexity, and in having the capacity for spontaneous movement and rapid motor responses to stimulation
one of the lower animals as distinguished from human beings

dt: {bc}animals that are raised on a farm

shortdef: animals that are raised on a farm

dt: {bc}any of various animals (such as the horse or sheep) domesticated so as to live and breed in a tame condition

shortdef: any of various animals (such as the horse or sheep) domesticated so as to live and breed in a tame condition
an animal used for carrying packs

dt: {bc}a person known for frequent often wild partying

shortdef: a person known for frequent often wild partying
an animal that lives in groups
